result.execSummary:
The defendant Angela M Kais was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
BAIL APPLIED TO DNA AND BLOOD DRAW COSTS.
Blood draw costs to be forwarded to the City of Waukesha Police Dept.
Maintain full time employment and/or combination of school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - FORTHWITH. Release for work, and AODA with standard release conditions. LAST 20 days STAYED to be used at Agent's discretion - huber/straight time to be used at Agent's discretion as well.

Defendant Angela M Kais in court with attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 1, 3 and 4 dismissed and read-in. Court orders warrant quashed. 


Court orders the following: 
Ct. 2:
- Total sentence: 3.5 years (Initial Confinement: 18 months, Extended Supervision: 2 years)  Stayed for 3 years Probation - 47 days credit if revoked.
- Fine totaling $1708.00 - apply bail 
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 - apply bail
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to City of Waukesha Police Department - apply bail. 
-  30 months Drivers License Revocation. 
-  30 months Ignition Interlock every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel meeting on June 17, 2015 or 30 days Huber consecutive.
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..  AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling. No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.  DNA Sample if not yet provided.
 - 200 days jail Condition Time with huber (nonworking hours) commencing FORTHWITH. Defendant to be released for work and AODA and any other standard release conditions. Last 20 days STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion - huber/straight time at the agents discretion.
